thread.title: Plainfield South football holds off Minooka
thread.title_full: Plainfield South football holds off Minooka

title: Plainfield South football holds off Minooka
text:
Plainfield South football holds off Minooka Published: Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 12:56 a.m. CDT • Updated: Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 3:52 a.m. CDT Caption (Eric Ginnard - eginnard@shawmedia.com) A wave of Plainfield South defenders brings down Minooka's Drew Turek on Friday at Minooka High School in Minooka. The Cougars beat the Indians, 34-27. By CURT HERRON - cherron@shawmedia.com 
MINOOKA – The Ridge Road rivalry between Plainfield South and Minooka has seen plenty of nailbiters throughout the years and Friday's meeting between the two joined that category. Related Links Schumacher beats Dixon to cap DSR sweep 
After allowing two touchdowns on the Indians' first nine plays from scrimmage, the Cougars only allowed two more scores the rest of the way and hung on to claim a 34-27 Southwest Prairie Conference victory, their fourth straight in the series. 
Despite allowing 488 yards of offense, including 368 through the air, in addition to a season-high point total, South (4-3, 4-1) kept Minooka (4-3, 2-3) from scoring on five of its final seven series, all of which ended inside the Cougars' 30-yard line. On their last series, the Indians drove to South's 1 before turning the ball over on downs with 46 seconds left. 
South quarterback Nicholas Deppe was 12 of 15 for 253 yards and threw three long touchdown passes. He tossed a 57-yarder to Jake Maher, a 77-yard strike to Dolphin Mitchell and a 67-yard score to Austin Deal. 
The Cougars, who finished with 403 total yards, also received a 69-yard scoring run from Danny Saracco (10 carries, 91 yards, 10 tackles) and a 35-yard touchdown run from Maher (10 carries, 45 yards). 
Minooka quarterback John Carnagio was 25 of 45 for 368 yards and two touchdowns. He tossed a 71-yard strike to Isaiah Hill (four catches, 91 yards) and a 30-yard score to Joshua Garcia (eight catches, 88 yards). Jacor Blakney (10 carries, 97 yards) scored on a 73-yard run and Mike Malinowski added a 7-yard score. 
South's Eric Johnson had nine tackles, including three sacks, while Minooka's Matt Brozovich made 10 tackles. Also for the Cougars, Mitchell Ganassin blocked a 25-yard field goal try and Tyler Jensen intercepted a pass at his 16 midway through the fourth quarter.
